result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah Scott Stephenson

defendant.name: Stephenson, Noah Scott
defendant.address: 6219 S. US Highway 51, Lot 3, Janesville, WI 53546

records.addlTxt: Agreement to hold open felony plea

8:31 AM Defendant Noah Scott Stephenson in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Noah Scott Stephenson.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger  in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders case dismissed and read in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:44 AM Defendant Noah Scott Stephenson in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Noah Scott Stephenson.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:00 PM Defendant Noah Scott Stephenson appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Noah Scott Stephenson.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney stands mute; Court enters not guilty plea and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:20 PM Defendant Noah Scott Stephenson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Noah Scott Stephenson.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address verified. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom and scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 2PM with other matters.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
No contact directly or indirectly with victim M.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Maintain absolute sobriety.
